alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 8:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Douglas, northwestern Elbert and south central Arapahoe Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 828 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado near Ponderosa Park, or 27 miles southeast of Denver, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Castle Rock, eastern Parker, Elizabeth, Larkspur, Ponderosa Park, The Pinery, Franktown and Greenland. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
